2020-12-04 @chris_herd Spurred by the COVID-19 pandemic, a sharp increase in remote work will result in: Workers will move cheaper/rural areas, a surge of startups focused on enabling asynchronous work, a surge in hobbies that creates local communities and reduces societal loneliness and isolation, companies rising/falling based on being early/late adopters of remote work, a shift away from time-based to performance-based jobs, general health and wellbeing improvements, more individual-use robots and automation, surges in RV sales, and a rise in short-term rentable office space / business parks to support digital nomads "Before 2030" Chris Herd Twitter Thread on the Future of Remote Work
